content: rock cap moss stitch is deceivingly easy to knit but always looks chic this pattern was inspired by the rock cap moss abbreviations co = cast on k = knit p = purl sts = stitches k3tog = knit 3 stitches together p3tog = purl 3 stitches together p2tog = purl 2 stitches together k2tog = knit 2 stitches together materials 150-180 yards heavy worsted or aran yarn of your choice the yarn featured here is big twist premium in cinnamon size 5mm/us 8 and size 5 5mm/us 9 16 circulars and 5 5mm/us 9 double points or 5mm/us 8 and 5 5mm/us 9 30-40 circular needles for magic loop moss stitch rounds 1-2 k1 p1 repeat around rounds 3-4 p1 k1 repeat around repeat rounds 1-4 pattern co 80 sts using 5mm/us 8 needles knit in k1p1 ribbing for 5 about 27 rounds page 1 of 2 body switch to 5 5mm/us 9 needles begin with round 3 of moss stitch pattern and continue in pattern for 39 rounds ending with round 1 of moss stitch pattern piece should measure approximately11 5 from co edge begin crown shaping crown shaping round 1 k3tog p1 k1 p1 k1 p1 repeat around 60 sts remain rounds 2-3 knit rounds 3-4 of moss stitch pattern round 4 k3tog p1 k1 p1 repeat around 40 sts round 5 knit round 2 of moss stitch pattern round 6 p3tog k1 repeat around 20 sts round 7 knit round 4 of moss stitch pattern round 8 p2tog 10 sts round 9 k2tog 5 sts finishing cut long tail and thread through remaining 5 sts using a darning needle weave in ends block if using natural fibers special thanks to melisa and hannah for their contributions page 2 of 2
